meanings.definition: A type of weed with triangular stems and small tubers.
meanings.sent1: The garden was overrun with nutsedges, making it difficult to grow other plants.
meanings.sent2: The farmer had to constantly battle nutsedges invading his crops.
meanings.sent3: The nutsedges seemed to have a party in the garden, inviting all their weedy friends.
meanings.sent4: The nutsedges spread like wildfire, taking over every inch of soil they could find.
meanings.sent5: Beware of the nutsedges, for they will sneakily take root and multiply in no time.

meanings.definition: Plants of the genus Cyperus, typically found in wet or marshy areas.
meanings.sent1: The nutsedges near the pond added a touch of green to the marshy landscape.
meanings.sent2: Birds often nest among the nutsedges growing by the water's edge.
meanings.sent3: The nutsedges by the swamp held a secret meeting, discussing their growth strategies.
meanings.sent4: The nutsedges stood tall like guardians of the wetlands, protecting the delicate ecosystem.
meanings.sent5: The nutsedges danced gracefully in the breeze, their leaves shimmering in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: Any of various grasslike plants with edible tubers.
meanings.sent1: The nutsedges in the field provided a source of food for the foraging animals.
meanings.sent2: People in the village harvested nutsedges for their nutritious tubers.
meanings.sent3: The nutsedges decided to have a tuber race to see who was the fastest underground.
meanings.sent4: The nutsedges hid their tubers like buried treasure, waiting for the right time to sprout.
meanings.sent5: The nutsedges' tubers were like hidden gems, waiting to be unearthed by those in need.
